alert.note: Alert for Maricopa; Pinal (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued June 29 at 12:30PM MST until June 29 at 1:30PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Maricopa County in south central Arizona... Pinal County in southeastern Arizona... * Until 130 PM MST. * At 1229 PM MST, doppler radar detected a wall of dust was along a line extending from Big Horn to Freeman to 21 miles southeast of Estrella to 10 miles northeast of Kaka, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Less than one mile visibility. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes AZ Interstate 8 between mile markers 132 and 151. Locations impacted include... Freeman and Big Horn. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
